pages.text: For too long, the villagers of the realm have peddled their wares without any regulation or oversight! Such anarchy will surely drive the economy to ruin!$(p)In the interest of promoting fair and equitable trade, the Tradewinds Consortium has established in each village a central $(bold)Commodity Market$().

Any village that spawns in the overworld will have its own Commodity Market, as will player-created villages. By interacting with a village's $(l:overview/market_board)Market Board$(), prospective merchants can buy and sell $(l:overview/goods)Goods$() there.$(p)The specific $(l:overview/goods)Goods$() that are available, as well as their prices, are determined by their $(l:overview/supply_and_demand)Supply and Demand$() in that specific market. For example, a desert village is unlikely to sell fish.
Different villages will have different Commodity Markets and will thus trade $(l:overview/goods)Goods$() at different prices. Exploiting these price differences is key to making money as a merchant!
